title: Global Markets Weakened on Monday on Various Concerns
text:
PSG Wealth Daily Investment Update, 25 September 2019

The JSE closed lower a day before Heritage Day as international factors weighed on global investor sentiment. The JSE All Share fell 1.39% on Monday.Apple Inc (NASDAQ: ) boosted the and the Nasdaq on Monday, even as gains were limited by mixed economic cues in the face of a prolonged US-China trade war. At 20h15 the Nasdaq was up flat at 0.08%.European bourses had a difficult day on Monday following the release of a slew of disappointing economic data for the region, with Germany’s latest Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) chief among these concerns. Shortly after the JSE closed, Germany’s was down 1.18% and France’s 1.19%Hong Kong stocks ended lower on Monday, as US-China trade uncertainties and concerns over political protests weighed on risk appetite. The fell 0.85%.Around the region, the MSCI AC Asia ex Japan Index weakened by 0.29%, while Japan’s Index was up 0.16%.After beginning Monday on a weak note, the rand turned positive in afternoon trade. At 20h15 it had gained 0.35% to R14.87/$.Gold prices were unchanged on Monday, as investors remained on the side-lines awaiting clarity on US-China trade talks, while escalating tensions in the Middle East provided some support. An ounce of traded at $1 525.55 at 20h15.Oil fell below $64 a barrel on Monday, pressured by the prospect of a faster-than-expected full restart of Saudi Arabian oil output and by fresh signs of European economic weakness.
